title: Mono font is ruining my life
content:
I would really appreciate anyone that can shed light on this font. It is so familiar that I’m sure I’ve seen it before!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081208085225im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Text_4944.jpg)

 [‹ Racing Post newspaper typefaces](http://web.archive.org/web/20081208085225/http:/typophile.com/node/52351 "Go to previous forum topic") [Font from the band "Editors" ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081208085225/http:/typophile.com/node/52353 "Go to next forum topic")
author: matttyson

comments.content:
not sure what this is, but kettler from process is a nice mono:

[http://www.processtypefoundry.com/typefaces/kettler/index.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20081208085225/http:/www.processtypefoundry.com/typefaces/kettler/index.html "http://www.processtypefoundry.com/typefaces/kettler/index.html")

I did post it a couple of weeks ago, but only had one response... I thought that it was worth another go. What I like about it, is how soft it is for a monospaced font.

Thanks for that Simon. There are some great fonts in the process foundry.

Faxo  
FF Magda Clean

Are the closest that I can find.
Replica Mono by Lineto is close, but thats not it...

Why don’t you email or call ’allens printers’ and ask them?

I take it you have their number! :P

Do you know what?...That is so crazy that it might just work! I need a cover of some sort. Maybe I need a quote for my new business cards?

oesj - I wish I’d thought o that 2 weeks ago.
Matthew, why do you need a cover? Most people would be flattered by your enthusiasm :)
I did the same thing a few years ago — contacted a photographer’s rep whose business card typography I admired. He was indeed flattered that I asked.
